title: Maturation and circuit integration of transplanted human cortical organoids
abstract: We show that human stem cell-derived cortical organoids transplanted into the somatosensory cortex of newborn athymic rats develop mature cell types that integrate into sensory and motivation-related circuits. Magnetic resonance imaging allows monitoring of post-transplantation organoid growth across multiple stem cell lines and animals, while single nucleus profiling reveals high cell diversity and progression of corticogenesis, as well as the emergence of an activity-dependent transcriptional program in neurons.
overall_design: single nucleus RNA-sequencing of transplanted human cortical organoid and age matched cortical organoid
summary: We show that human stem cell-derived cortical organoids transplanted into the somatosensory cortex of newborn athymic rats develop mature cell types that integrate into sensory and motivation-related circuits.
